title: ByteDance’s TikTok Playbook Is Winning Consumer AI
description: ByteDance Ltd. is best known abroad as the embattled parent of TikTok. At home, though, it has quietly seized the crown for China’s top consumer artificial intelligence app while bucking all the trends — a feat that offers lessons in the global tech race.

title: Globe says AI use has helped it save P125M
description: GLOBE Telecom Inc. on Sunday said that it had saved more than 11.3 million kilowatt-hours (kWh) of electricity last year, equivalent to approximately P125 million, by using artificial intelligence (AI) to drive smarter and more efficient energy use across its network and facilities.

title: AI helps drive record $11.8 billion in Black Friday online spending
description: ARTIFICIAL intelligence (AI)-powered shopping tools helped drive a surge in US online spending on Black Friday, as shoppers bypassed crowded stores and turned to chatbots to compare prices and secure discounts amid concerns about tariff-driven price hikes.

title: "Working Will Be Optional In Next 20 Years": Elon Musk's Big Prediction
description: Elon Musk has predicted that people "won't have to work at all" in the future. And, artificial intelligence (AI) and robotics would bring about that change, said the tech billionaire.

title: "Avatar: Fire and Ash" director James Cameron on generative AI: "That's horrifying to me"
description: The "Avatar" director, who uses performance capture to help create fantasy characters, has consistently raised the level of movie visual effects. But James Cameron believes using artificial intelligence to create a character and performance without an actor is "horrifying."
content: Much of what we see from the Earth-like moon of Pandora, the fantastical setting for the "Avatar" franchise, comes from a soundstage in Los Angeles, where scenes from the second and third movies were filmed. "We had to build an ocean," director James... [6080 chars]

title: In Future, Working Will Be Optional: Elon Musk On AI
description: Billionaire Elon Musk believes that artificial intelligence would render working an "optional activity" for humans "In the future, it won't be the case that you might be in a city to get a job. My prediction is that in the future, working will be optional," the tech entrepreneur told Nikhil Kamath in the latest episode of the Zerodha co-founder's WTF podcast. "I say that in less than 10 years, working at all will be optional."
content:
